snippet: The three were interviewed by CNN and The Associated Press, and the choreography of the interviews suggested that North Korea wanted to use the prisoners as bargaining leverage.
abstract: North Korea grants Associated Press and CNN interviews with incarcerated Americans Kenneth Bae, Jeffrey Edward Fowle and Mathew Todd Miller; men apologize for violating North Korea's laws and beseech Washington to send high-level emissary to negotiate their release.

byline.contributor: Helene Cooper contributed reporting from Washington, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: The three were interviewed by CNN and The Associated Press, and the choreography of the interviews suggested that North Korea wanted to use the prisoners as bargaining leverage.

headline.main: In Interviews, 3 Americans Held in North Korea Plead for U.S. Help
headline.print_headline: In Interviews, 3 Americans Held in North Korea Plead for U.S. Help
